sentences.en: Conceit comes from shallowness; arrogance is due to ignorance.
sentences.cn: 骄傲来自浅薄, 狂妄出于无知.

sentences.en: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.cn: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

sentences.en: He displayed a willful ignorance of their plight.
sentences.cn: 对于他们的困境他故意装作一无所知.

sentences.en: Her ignorance of the area put her at a decided disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 她对该地区一无所知，这显然对她不利。

sentences.en: I was alarmed by his naivety and ignorance of international affairs.
sentences.cn: 他对国际事务缺乏经验且无知，这很让我吃惊。

sentences.en: Ignorance of people brings fear, fear of the unknown.
sentences.cn: 人们的无知会带来恐惧，对未知事物的恐惧。

sentences.en: It's an ignorance we can ill afford.
sentences.cn: 这是我们难以承受的无知。

sentences.en: Maybe it is all due to my own ignorance.
Mr Giles pleads ignorance as his excuse.
sentences.cn: 贾尔斯先生把不知情当作自己的借口。

sentences.en: No plea can be set up on the ground of ignorance.
sentences.cn: 以无知为理由而提出的抗辩是不能成立的.

sentences.en: She displayed a woeful ignorance of the rules.
sentences.cn: 她对这些条例表现出可悲的无知。

sentences.en: Such attitudes are the product of woeful ignorance.
sentences.cn: 这样的态度是极度无知造成的。

sentences.en: The relation of disease to poverty and ignorance is easy to see.
sentences.cn: 疾病与贫穷、无知之间的关系是显而易见的.

sentences.en: They were at last freed from the fetters of ignorance.
sentences.cn: 他们终于从愚昧无知的束缚中解脱出来。

sentences.en: Tormented by her ignorance, Jenny delves into her mother's past.
sentences.cn: 珍妮为自己的一无所知而苦恼，开始探究起母亲的过去。

words.tran_cn: 不学无术的人；无知的人
忽略；不顾（ignore的过去分词）；不理会

trans.tran_en: lack of knowledge or information about something
